entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:35PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAINFALL TO CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL... After a brief break, rain will return to Southcentral late this evening and continue through Tuesday night. Expected additional rainfall amounts through Tuesday night: Anchorage Bowl: 0.75" to 1.00" Matanuska Valley: 1.00" to 1.50"
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 1:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Water Levels Continue on the Tanana River... The Tanana River continues to run near bankfull at some locations between Tok and Manley Hot Springs. Water levels on the Tanana River are expected to remain high through the week. Expect many gravel bars to remain underwater, with increased debris moving downriver.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 1:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...More Rain in the Alaska Range... Another moisture laden weather system is moving across the Interior and Alaska Range with rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 1.5 inch expected through Wednesday morning. Occasional rain is expected to continue through most of the coming week. Heaviest rainfall will be south of Kantishna and Healy in Denali
entry.cap:areaDesc: Denali; Eastern Alaska Range

entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * IMPACTS: Low Humidities...Hot Temperatures...and Strong Gusty Winds will create erratic fire behavior and new fire starts. * AFFECTED AREA: In Central WY...Fire Weather Zone 288.
